text: Whats the point of living if you are constantly scared of dyingI have severe hypochondria health anxiety somatic symptom disorder  If you don t know what that is its basically constantly panicking every day about a new illness that you re scared is gonna kill you  It all started when i was told i would have to do surgery  It was a very safe surgery  a   minute procedure where the doctor would have to cut in to my testicle and untwist my veins  Its a condition called varicocele  Its not a fatal condition nor is it even serious its just my testicular veins will feel swollen  Ever since that ive been focusing on every sensation  I woke up with a numb arm  My first thought was  stroke  I rushed myself to the emergency room after my arm started painfully aching  The doctor said im ok and gave me pain killers for the aches  I never ended up using the pain killers since my anxiety was gone and the arm aching went away  This was the time i learned about health anxiety and that you can imagine symptoms  But that day my pet cat spit on my mouth  I was horrified that i had rabies  I went to a doctor and was told i am perfectly safe  But then my cat scratched me and I panicked all over again and went to a different doctor  He also said im   fine  I cant take all this pain the stress caused  Im thinking about suicide  I love life i just think i have to force myself to die because if i dont  then i will die of rabies  But im too scared to die  I dont want to die painfully  I want an easy  non painful way of death
summary: I have severe hypochondria health anxiety somatic symptom disorder. It's basically panicking every day about a new illness that you're scared is gonna kill you. It all started when I was told I would have to do a procedure called varicocele. My testicular veins will feel swollen and I woke up with a numb arm. The doctor gave me painkillers for the aches. My cat scratched me and I was afraid I had rabies.
cleaned: severe hypochondria health anxiety somatic symptom disorder basically panic day new illness scared go kill start tell procedure call varicocele testicular vein feel swollen wake numb arm doctor give painkiller ache cat scratch afraid rabie

text: Life ain t working out for meI ve had bipolar symptoms for over a decade and was diagnosed in the fall of   I thought that the diagnosis would lead to recovery and things have improved to the point where I m able to work part time but I still experience a lot of pain  The way I explained it at my last therapy session is that sometimes I can handle life but I m never happy to be alive and a lot of the time I wish I were dead  I ve read books and articles  talked to people  take medication  been hospitalized  all that jazz  Nothing stops the pain  My therapist says occasionally that he thinks I don t want to die  I want the pain to stop  I don t see a difference  The only reason I m alive still is because my family is very attached to me and I really don t want to hurt them
summary: Bipolar disorder is not working out for me. I'm able to work part time but I'm still in a lot of pain. My family is very attached to me, so I don't want to hurt them.
cleaned: bipolar disorder not work able work time lot pain family attached not want hurt

text: I ve been toxic for too long I used to think that people distanced from me  But instead  I was the one who distanced from them When I think about my past  I was so childish  so inmature  so clingy  so negative and so annoying that I understand why people didn t want to get close to me Being honest  When I think about my future  I m afraid that I ll end up dying alone  old and broken in my home  maybe   years in the future  and no one will find me for a long while I don t know how to face some people  I don t know how to apologize  or if I should do so  I don t know how to start being another person I don t even know how to deal with a misdiagnosis  I don t know how to tell people that I don t have Asperger s when they think I have  and I m not sure how to keep dealing with being treated like a child God  I lost a lot of things when I was depressed  And I don t know how to get them back or how to start moving on Without internet at home  it s really difficult to think about other stuff I wish I could be born again so I could fix all of those mistakes
summary: I used to think that people distanced themselves from me, but in fact I was the one who distanced myself. I was childish, inmature, clingy, negative and annoying. I lost a lot of things when I was depressed.
cleaned: think people distance fact distance childish mature clingy negative annoying lose lot thing depressed
